ud2.10:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Anupiya in a mango grove.
ud2.10:1.3: Now at that time, Venerable Bhaddiya son of Kāḷīgodhā, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, frequently expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.10:2.4: “Without a doubt, Venerable Bhaddiya leads the spiritual life dissatisfied.
ud2.10:2.5: It’s when recalling the pleasures of royalty he formerly enjoyed as a layperson that, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, he frequently expresses this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.10:3.1: Then those mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what was happening.
ud2.10:4.1: So the Buddha addressed one of the monks,
ud2.10:4.2: “Please, monk, in my name tell the mendicant Bhaddiya that
ud2.10:5.1: “Yes, sir,” that monk replied. He went to Bhaddiya and said to him,
ud2.10:5.3: “Yes, reverend,” Bhaddiya replied. He went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
ud2.10:6.1: “Is it really true, Bhaddiya, that even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, you frequently express this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.10:7.3: “Formerly, as a layperson ruling the land, my guard was well organized within and without the royal compound, within and without the city, and within and without the country.
ud2.10:7.4: But although I was guarded and defended in this way, I remained fearful, scared, suspicious, and nervous.
ud2.10:7.5: But these days, even when alone in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, I’m not fearful, scared, suspicious, or nervous. I live relaxed, unruffled, surviving on charity, my heart free as a wild deer.
ud2.10:7.6: It is for this reason that, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, I frequently expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.10:8.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.10:9.2: gone beyond any kind of existence;
ud2.10:9.3: happy, free from fear and sorrow—
ud2.10:9.4: even the gods can’t see them.”
